meanings.definition: Kept under control or held back
meanings.sent1: The shy girl felt repressed in social situations.
meanings.sent2: His repressed emotions finally surfaced during the therapy session.
meanings.sent3: The repressed laughter burst out unexpectedly during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent4: Her repressed creativity was like a caged bird longing to be set free.
meanings.sent5: The repressed anger simmered beneath his calm exterior.

meanings.sent1: The repressed child hesitated to speak up in class.
meanings.sent2: She had a repressed desire to travel the world.
meanings.sent3: The repressed excitement bubbled inside her like a shaken soda can.
meanings.sent4: His repressed passion for music was evident in every note he played.
meanings.sent5: The repressed fear gnawed at the edges of her mind.

meanings.definition: Prevented from being expressed or released
meanings.sent1: He repressed his urge to shout in frustration.
meanings.sent2: The memories of the accident were repressed for years.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally repressed the wrong button on the remote control.
meanings.sent4: The truth can only be repressed for so long before it emerges.
meanings.sent5: The artist repressed his emotions into his paintings, creating powerful art.
